primary_trope.name: extreme_experience
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Experience. Southern Cross Gravel is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: We gave Southern Cross Gravel the verdict: The Anti-Unbound Winery Finish. Elite tier. 71 out of 100. Let me tell you what that really means.
beats.text_on_screen: Southern Cross Gravel: The Anti-Unbound Winery Finish
beats.visual: Verdict badge slam + tier badge + avatar
beats.editing_note: Open with verdict like a boxing title card. Avatar with villain energy. Music: ominous build. PROMISE the viewer they'll learn the real story.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap + cognitive dissonance (verdict vs expectation).

beats.label: WHAT THEY TELL YOU
beats.narration: Here's the pitch. What the website wants you to believe.
beats.visual: Marketing highlights overlay — strengths as bullet points
beats.editing_note: Read strengths in an exaggerated 'promotional voice.' Avatar side-eyes camera. Bright, clean visuals — this is the 'too good to be true' section. CONTRAST PATTERN: this calm section sets up the burst at 0:50.

strengths: Montaluce Winery finish—wine, BBQ, live bluegrass, sunset over the vineyard
Honest mountain gravel—rewards climbers and descenders, not diesel engines
Small-town Georgia hospitality—family-friendly, accessible race director

beats.label: WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU
beats.narration: Now the stuff that doesn't make the brochure.
beats.visual: Red flag overlay — weaknesses with warning icons
beats.editing_note: BURST SEQUENCE at 0:50 transition (pattern interrupt). 5-10 quick cuts: meme reaction, avatar facepalm, red overlay flash, warning sound. Then settle into analysis. Each weakness gets its own visual card + avatar reaction.

weaknesses: Mud lottery—if it rains the week before, course becomes significantly harder (18% DNF in 2023)
Limited aid stations—35+ miles between stations means self-sufficiency required
Lodging pressure—Dahlonega is tiny, hotels fill fast, likely driving from Gainesville
Cold March starts—35-40°F mornings, dress wrong and you're numb for an hour
Day-of packet pickup only—no race-eve pickup option

beats.label: THE NUMBERS DON'T LIE
beats.narration: The scores that tell the real story. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off. Dahlonega sits around 1,400 feet elevation with course peaks barely touching 2,500 feet. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Competent operation. Shows up on time. Jason Lopez calls the start "a total mess" with riders squeezing through a single-width timing strip, creating quarter-mile delays even for front-positioned racers. Climate. 3 out of 5. Pack for two seasons.
beats.visual: Score cards — lowest 3 dimensions with explanations
beats.editing_note: RE-ENGAGEMENT BEAT — this is the ~2 min mark. Start with the least bad score, escalate to worst. Each score reveal: brief silence (0.5s), then number slams in. Avatar reaction scales with how bad the score is. Von Restorff: visually isolate the worst score (different color, bigger text, longer hold). [RIFF HERE] after the worst score reveal.

beats.label: THE BOTTOM LINE
beats.narration: If you want flat, fast, tactical pack racing, this isn't it. If you want punchy climbs, technical descents, and a winery finish that makes you forget your legs hurt. Southern Cross delivers. This is the Southeast's answer to mountain gravel: smaller field, bigger personality, and a post-race party that justifies the entry fee alone. You'll either love the relentless rollers or walk up Woody Gap. But you'll definitely drink good wine at the end.
beats.editing_note: PAYOFF. Close the open loop from the hook. Avatar delivers final take directly to camera. End ABRUPTLY — never signal 'we're wrapping up.' MrBeast rule: cut to CTA mid-energy.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown. All 14 dimensions. Free prep kit. Link in bio.
beats.editing_note: Keep energy up. Don't wind down.
beats.engagement_question: Roast or defend Southern Cross Gravel. Go.
